chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Hopmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. Hopmann

defendant.name: Hopmann, Michael S.
defendant.address: 144 E. Washington Street, Lake Mills, WI 53551

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #20CF264, #20CF358, #22CF73 called at 9:51am.
Defendant Michael S. Hopmann in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
In Case #22CF73 Prelim Waiver and Arraignment are held: 
---Mr. Hopmann waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
---Service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
___________________
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " is entered in Case #20CF264-Count #2, and in Case #22CF73-Counts #3 and #4; factual basis stipulated. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in the remaining counts [Case #20CF264-Count #1;#3, #4; Case #20CF358; and Case #22CF73--Counts #1, #2.]
recess 10:01am, reconvene 10:10am 

In Case #20CF264-Count #2, and in Case #22CF73-Counts #3 and #4 the Court withhold sentence and places Mr. Hopmann on Probation for 3 years concurrent with conditions:  
--as to Case #20CF264-Count #2 only:  to serve 120 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on June 3rd at 12:00pm.. The Court does not allow transfer of the service of the jail term to another county. There is not to be any use of electronic monitoring or other passive service of this jail term.  Mr. Hopmann is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to engage in AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence toward anyone 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, and surcharges; also to pay the $25 drug testing fee in Case #20CF264

Days credit for time already served:  8  days in Case #20CF264
Days credit for time already served: 1  day in Case #22CF73
recess 10:28am

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Letter from Att Huebner RE Billable hours
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #20CF264, #20CF358, #22CF73 called at 10:43am
Defendant Michael S. Hopmann in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that the jury-trial dates at the end of May should remain on the Court's calendar.  
recess 10:44am 

NEXT:  (1) schedule case #22CF73 for Status Conference on May 24th at 9:30am, noting in the calendar comments that the case is at prelim-stage, (2) the May 24th date remains on the Court's calendar in case #20CF264(FSSC) and case #20CF358 (Status Conference),  (3) the May 31st Jury Trial (Case #20CF264 only) remains on the Court's calendar
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK; Second hearing on this date] 
 cases #20CF264 and #20CF358 and #22CF73 called at 3:04pm 
Defendant Michael S. Hopmann now appears. Attorney Karl Huebner appears. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
The Court direct that Case #22CF73 is to be assigned to Branch I.  
The Court quashes the Warrants in cases #20CF264 and #20CF358.
144 E. Washington Street, Lake Mills address is current. 
recess 3:07pm 

NEXT:  (1) Case #22CF73 is to be assigned to Branch I,  (2) Pretrial Conference is to be held informally,  (2) Status Conference in April 25th at 10:30am--JA note in Case #22CF73 comments that the case is at prelim stage, (3) the May 24th FSSC/Status and May 31st Jury Trial (as to Case #20CF264 only) remain on the Court's calendar
Status conference on March 24, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--comply with all licensing restrictions 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 10:22 AM Defendant Michael S. Hopmann in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Michaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--comply with all licensing restrictions 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

Attorney Huebner informs the Court that he is appointed to the Defendants other cases. Defendant provides current financial information, the Court appoints Attorney Huebner to this case.
recess 10:27 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 3/24/22 at 11:00 am  [Clerk is to appoint Attorney Huebner to case]
